name: One Day Trip from Puerto Jimenez
description:
Don´t miss the opportunity to join us on our one-day trip to experience the wonderful Corcovado National Park. We leave Puerto Jimenez at 5:30 am and after a 2-hour trip arrives at Carate Beach.

From this point, we’ll hike along the beautiful beach for one hour to get to La Leona Station

Throughout the trip to Corcovado, your guide will spot animals and explain about their natural history and their habitats. It is common to see several species of monkeys, toucans, macaws, sloths and many more! We’ll also talk about insects and plants, and the National Park itself.

On this trip we will hike until ‘El Barco Point’, where we will cross the Madrigal River, giving you a chance for a refreshing swim in the crystal-clear water!

OUR PACKAGE INCLUDES:

  • Bilingual Local Naturalist and Biological Private Guide
  • Packed Lunch (optional)
  • Park entrance fee
  • Fresh fruit
short_description: Throughout the trip to Corcovado, your guide will spot animals and explain about their habitats.

name: Two Day Trip from Puerto Jimenez
description:
Our local experienced tour guide will help you to find out all the secrets of the rainforest and its Inhabitants. You’ll also learn about their habitats, whether it’s animals, insects or plants! We’ll start off with a 6 or 7-hour hike to Sirena Biological Station, where we’ll spend the night.

The next day we’ll have an early breakfast, then we’ll make our way to Carate, where we will be picked up to go back to Jimenez. But even on the way back, keep your eyes open, as it is early in the morning, it´s a good time to spot more animals!

We will cross the Madrigal River again, giving you another chance to refresh and take a break. We will return to Puerto Jimenez around 3:00 pm.

OUR PACKAGE INCLUDES:

  • Bilingual Local Naturalist and Biological Private Guide, with ICT and MINAET Licenses and First AID knowledge. 
  • All Entrance fees to the Park
  • All meals included
short_description: Our local experienced tour guide will help you to find out all the secrets of the rainforest and its Inhabitants.

name: Three Day Trip From Puerto Jimenez
description:
This is the perfect trip for adventurous Nature Lovers! We leave Puerto Jimenez at 5.30am and after a 2-hour trip we arrive at Carate Beach. From this point, we’ll hike along the beautiful beach for one hour to get to La Leona Station. Throughout the trip to Corcovado, your guide will spot animals and explain about their natural history and their habitats. It is common to see several species of monkeys, toucans, macaws, sloths and more! We’ll also talk about insects and plants, and the National Park itself. The hike will be around 7 hours long, crossing several rivers on the way.

We’ll spend the night in Sirena Biological Station, and start the next day early at 5 am, as the morning is an ideal time to spot animals. After 2 hours we will return to the station for breakfast.

After breakfast, we will take a little break and then resume our walk towards the Guanacaste trails, such as Espavel Trail, Sirena Trail, where your experienced tour guide will use his expertise to help you discover the real wildlife and rainforest. A great number of wild animals are known to live in the park, such as  wild pigs, crocodiles, and several species of monkeys. Also, many different bird species can be seen, such as toucans, scarlet macaws, hummingbirds, parrots, parakeets and more. After the hike, we will enjoy lunch where you can relax at the paradisiacal Sirena Beach or at the Station. The last day will start with an early breakfast, after it we´ll start our way back to Carate, where you’ll be picked up and head back to Puerto Jiménez.

OUR PACKAGE INCLUDES:

  • Bilingual Local Naturalist & Biological Private Guide, with ICT and MINAET Licenses and First AID knowledge.
  • All entrance fees and lodging at Sirena.
  • All meals included
short_description: This is the perfect trip for adventurous Nature Lovers!

name: Scuba Diving Ca�o Island
description:
Includes: Entrance fee to the reserve, complete diving equipment, boat and captain and a certified guide.

It’ll take you one hour by boat to Isla del Caño. Once we are there, 2 dives in different marine areas around Caño Island are available, each dive is about 45 minutes.

Between the first and the second dive, you’ll make a stop at Caño Island. Later, the ship heads to San Josecito beach where we’ll have a picnic. After lunch, we travel back to Drake Bay.

name: Dos Brazos del Rio Tigre to Piedras Blancas
description:
3 Days Tour - All Inclusive

 

This tour was created to help the local people improve their quality of life since they are the most valuable asset in the protection and conservation of the Osa Peninsula.  This tour allows tourists to experience the culture and lifestyle that has developed at this remote region. 

 

You can choose to experience this tour in 2 days or up to 5 days. 

There are is a wide variety of activities to do along the way.  On the first day you can visit a recently discovered ecological monument “Boca Gallardo,” a place with important precolumbian architecture evidence.

You can start the trip bird watching around the Rio Tigre town before you set out into the “El Tigre Corcovado” trail where you will head to Descanso el Pizote, where you will spend your first night.  This small “finca” is nestled deep into the mountains and has a small and rustic cabin with bunk beds, where you will stay in the home of the local family.  Once you are settled in you can head up to the viewpoint or down to the river to relax and refresh and learn a little from a small gold mine and its culture.  In the evening, after a home-cooked meal, get ready to go out on a night-hike and explore the forest in the dark. 

On day 2 you head out early for the 6hour hike to Finca Piedras Blancas.  You will spend the day walking on the of Corcovado National Park where you will see primary and secondary forest and beautiful animals and especially a wide range of birds and insects.  Once you arrive to Finca Piedras Blancas you will explore waterfalls, learn about gold mining culture, rest, and experience the simplicity and peace in this remote area.

On the third day you will do the 6 hour trek through pristine forest back to Rio Tigre where you will have incredible views and the opportunity to see some of the many animal and plant species of the Osa Peninsula. 

Note that this tour can be extended up to 5 days or shortened to 2 days.

name: Night Walks
description:
Includes: Bilingual guide - Fresh fruit

Experience the magic of the rainforest at night! Use your flashlight and the help of a guide, to discover unusual nocturnal creatures and their habitats. A great opportunity to see bats, insects and other wonders of this hidden nocturnal world.
short_description: Experience the magic of the rainforest at night! Use your flashlight and the help of a guide, to discover unusual nocturnal..

name: Mix Tour
description:
Includes: Bilingual guide - Fresh fruit & Water

Start a bird watching hike at Rio Tigre to spot birds in one of the best locations for it.  We take a 30-minute hike up the Tigre river, crossing back-and-forth and along hidden pathways until coming to a two-tiered waterfall with perfect swimming natural pools underneath the waterfalls.

Our guide will pack up fresh fruit and your favorite beverage to enjoy on the beach just beneath the falls. Local gold miners will be seen along the way, welcoming you to take a shot at panning for gold yourself and rooting for you to get lucky. This is an easy and fun hike good for all ages!

name: Bird Watching
description:
Include: Bilingual Guide - Telescopes and Fresh fruit

Come to walk with us in the surroundings of Puerto Jimenez and enjoy the flora and fauna of this beautiful place, accompanied by a local bilingual guide.

He will help you discover the unique wonders in this environment, and you can spot iguanas, macaws, toucans, and alligators. This is a great opportunity to enjoy the area’s typical nature without hiking long distances.

name: Sport Fishing
description:
Include: Sandwiches, Chips, Water, Soda, Beer and Fresh Fruit.

We offer a combination of recreational fishing for red snapper, roosterfish, amberjack, dorado, yellowfin tuna, sailfish, and marlin. We provide you with baits and tackles, and you’ll be accompanied by an English-speaking mate.

name: Ca�a Blanca Sanctuary & Dolphin Tour
description:
Include: Sandwiches, Water, Juice and Fresh Fruit.

Cross the majestic Golfo Dulce by boat and visit the non-profit Wildlife Caña Blanca Foundation.

Learn about their rehabilitation programs and have a hands-on activity, while helping with their injured and orphaned animals and birds. Most animals are endangered species that eventually will be released at Piedras Blancas National Park. Price includes $25 per person as a donation to the Sanctuary.

Recommendations: Wear a swimsuit and a hat, we recommend a long sleeve shirt, and lots of sunscreen.
short_description: Cross the majestic Golfo Dulce by boat and visit the non-profit Wildlife Ca�a Blanca Foundation.

name: Golfo Dulce Dolphin Tour
description:
Include: Sandwiches, Water, Juice and Fresh Fruit.

Enjoy snorkeling and exploring the Golfo Dulce and its lush coastline. A great opportunity to see 3 species of dolphins (common, bottled-nosed or spotted), gray and pilot whales, and sea turtles.

Snorkel equipment included.

Recommendations: Wear a swimsuit and a hat, we recommend a long sleeve shirt, and lots of sunscreen
short_description: Enjoy snorkeling and exploring the Golfo Dulce and its lush coastline. A great opportunity to see 3 species of dolphins...

name: Dolphin and Rio Esquinas Boat Tour
description:
Include: Sandwiches, Water, Juice and Fresh Fruit.

Departing from Puerto Jimenez, we will be able to find dolphins, flying fish, seabirds, and maybe even whales (on whale season). Depending on the tide, float from the Golfo up the Rio Esquinas to explore deep into a tree-covered river brimming with shorebirds, mangrove swamps, and the rainforest.

Recommendations: Wear a swimsuit and a hat, we recommend a long sleeve shirt, and lots of sunscreen

name: Golden Legacy Tour
description:
Embark on a unique artisanal gold mining experience.
Discover the traditional process of gold extraction in the river while learning about the local traditions that have been kept alive over time.

  • Duration: 2 to 3 hours of relaxing exploration.
  • Difficulty: Easy. Perfect for enjoying with family, friends, or solo.
  • Includes: Expert guide, exploration tools, and a delicious local snack.

Cost: $45 per person.
Discover the roots of a community and experience a journey full of stories that make a difference.
